description: This trap indicates that the requested segment file
could not be found. The segment file must be copied
into either the <node>/announcement/preload or
or <node>/announcement/ondemand directory.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnouncementFileNotFoundNotification SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnSegStatSegId i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 1

description: This trap indicates that announcement segment could not
be loaded because segment memory on the specified card is
full. Segment ID, Version and Length pertain to the most
recent segment load failure. Verify the length of this
segment is within reason.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnouncementSegmentLoadFailureNotification SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnSegStatSegId i 9999 SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnSegStatVersion i 9999 SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnSegStatLength i 9999 SONUS-ANNOUNCEMENT-RESOURCES-MIB::sonusAnnSegMemFullCount i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 1
